entry.title: Combined summary - BIP 70 and OP_RETURN
entry.summary: The context of the discussion is primarily about BIP 70 compliance with regards to Bitcoin Core and Android Bitcoin Wallet. The conversation begins with a statement that if clients are not spec compliant, they should be. Currently, only Bitcoin Core and Android Bitcoin Wallet implement BIP 70. A question is posed regarding whether all BIP 70 compatible clients support the creation of all standard output types, including OP_RETURN outputs. From the given context, it appears that the process of encoding the OP_RETURN script into an Output structure is being discussed. However, there seems to be confusion regarding the question being asked as the answer is already provided in the first paragraph. It is not clear what the question is exactly. OP_RETURN is a specific type of transaction output used in Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies to embed arbitrary data into the blockchain without causing any change in the ownership or transfer of coins. An Output structure refers to the part of a transaction that specifies where the coins are being sent and how much is being sent. It contains the recipient's address and the amount of cryptocurrency being transferred. The Output message allows for the specification of any standard TxOut script, including the ability to specify OP_RETURN outputs in BIP 70 payment requests.Additionally, the message ends with a call to support online privacy by using email encryption whenever possible, with a link provided for further information. It is recommended to use attachments such as a PGP key and digital signature for added security measures.
